result.execSummary:
The defendant Aimber M. Kelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 11:17am 
Defendant Aimber M. Kelman in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance 

Atty. Luchsinger verifies receipt of PSI; no factual corrections
ADA Teuber verifies receipt of PSI; some factual corrections 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Ms. Kelman   to  2 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   12 months.  This sentence is to served CONCURRENT to sentence in being (Racine Co.)   

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--not have any relationship
--drug testing fees in the amount of $50
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--repayment of attorney fees 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 12:03pm
cc: DA cert. copy by COC on 3/13/17. sf
Order to Produce defendant - Sent - 03-17-17

Defendant for the 3/17/17 hearing

cc: DA cert. copy by COC on 3/9/17. sf
Order to Produce defendant for the 3/17/17 hearing
Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Judge Weston presiding for Branch III:  
[MK] case called at 3:04pm. 
Defendant Aimber M. Kelman in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Sentencing Hearing today.  
Judge Weston explains that she is presiding unexpectedly this afternoon after Judge Wambach was called away.  
ADA Teuber indicates that there are three new factors of significance which were not known at the time the Pre-Sentence Investigation Report was filed on January 6th. Since that time the State has become aware: 
(#1) there is a new uncharged referral for Ms. Kelman related to drug delivery,  (#2) the Defendant's boyfriend, who is referred to througout the PSI Report, has had a change in his circumstances--an arrest and multiple new drug charges against him,  (#3) the pending Racine cases are now concluded and Ms. Kelman has been sentenced and received a three year prison term.  The State believes that these are all factors that the Court would want to consider at the Sentencing Hearing.  
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that he just learned of this information earlier today. 
recess 3:07pm (for counsel to meet, and for Judge Weston to read the Criminal Complaint and the Pre-Sentence Report). 
reconvene 3:25pm. 
The Court indicates it is now prepared to proceed to sentencing if the parties agree.  
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense is requesting rescheduling of the sentencing.  
In discussing a rescheduled date, Attorney Luchsinger notes that t is anticipated that Ms. Kelman will be moved to Taycheedah Correctional in the days ahead.
recess 3:27pm 

NEXT:  reschedule Sentencing Hearing
cc: DA(efile), Attorney Luchsinger by COC on 1/6/17. sf
Order to Produce defendant from Racine County Jail on 2-21-17 for proceedings in Branch 3      cc: Certified Copy  to DA   12-5-16  /tn
Order to Produce defendant
Sentencing hearing on February 21, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 10:51am [ma]
Defendant Aimber M. Kelman in court, in custody with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

The Court orders a PSI to be completed, to be completed within the next 45 days, the PSI author need not attend and sentencing is to occur out 60 days from todays date.

recess:11:18am

NEXT: Sentencing on 2/21/17 at 3:00pm

cc: Certified copy to DA 11-10-16  /tn
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from Racine County Jail for proceedings in Br 3, Rm 125 of the Circuit Court of Jefferson County on November 29, 2016 at 10:00 AM
Status conference on November 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:04am. 
Defendant Aimber M. Kelman appears via videoconferencing from the Racine County Jail, in custody.  Her counsel, Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Luchsinger requests that the case be scheduled for another status on a date after November 21st so that the outcome of a pending Waukesha County case will be known; this Waukehsa outcome-information may assist the parties in reaching an agreement in this case.  
The Court grants this request. 
In response to the Court's inquiry of Ms. Kelman on her custody status, Ms. Kelman indicates that she is unsure whether she will be in custody or not as of the November 29th court date.  The Court emphasizes to Ms. Kelman that if she is out of custody on the date, she must come to court to appear. 
recess 9:07am. 


NEXT:  Status Conference on November 29th 10:00am--arrangements are to be made for Ms. Kelman to via videoconferencing unless Attorney Luchsinger informs the Court and the State that the case is proceeding to final hearing on this date
Status conference on November 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
for Continuance of the Status Conference on 8-30-16 at 10:30 am *Stipulation not forwarded to Court as Atty Luchsinger contacted the Court's JA and notified her that he would be appearing*

Case called at 3:05pm [mo]
Defendant Aimber M. Kelman in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin; replaced by ADA Hall at 3:07 until end of hearing.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Defendant verifies date of birth; provides new Dewey St, Watertown address

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Kelman. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Ms. Kelman indicates that she was present when the Court gave another Defendant their Right to counsel and constructive waiver of counsel warnings 
--Ms. Kelman indicates she wishes to obtain counsel

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit *OR* Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5000   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Joseph Lehmann
--no possession of any needles without a valid prescription
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
--Ms. Kelman is to contact the Jefferson SPD office by 3pm on 12/9/15 to schedule an appointment for a financial eligibility evaluation. 
recess: 3:12pm 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/2/16 at 2:00pm
